summary: Three-dimensional printing, commonly referred to as 3D printing, represents a transformative technology within the information technology and data processing sector. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, 3D printing raises significant considerations regarding intellectual property rights, product safety, and compliance with existing regulations. The European Union is actively developing policies to address the implications of 3D printing, particularly concerning the protection of designs and patents, as well as the potential for regulatory harmonization across member states. This redirect emphasizes the preferred term "3D printing," which encapsulates the broader concept of additive manufacturing technologies impacting various industries.
